title: 19.2 Mergeable-heap Operations
content:
Section 19.2

Mergeable-heap Operations

Summary

Insert, minimum, union, and extract-min operations on Fibonacci heaps.

Key Points

  • INSERT: create new tree with one node, add to root list - O(1)
  • MINIMUM: just return min pointer - O(1)
  • UNION: concatenate root lists, update min - O(1)
  • EXTRACT-MIN: remove min, add children to root list, consolidate
  • CONSOLIDATE: link trees of same degree until all degrees unique - O(log n) amortized

Example

Extract-min triggers cleanup: trees with same degree are linked, reducing total trees.

Why It Matters

O(1) insert and union are key advantages over binary heaps.
